SLogo.FunctionEvaluate.Functions

Interface IterableInvokable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Invokable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    BinaryIterable, MultiTurtleSet, Setting, TurtleBinary, TurtleUnary, UnaryIterable

    public interface IterableInvokable
extends Invokable
    This interface allows otherwise fixed argument operations to be applied to an arbitrary number arguments, by iteratively applying the operation to each set of arguments supplied

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface SLogo.FunctionEvaluate.Functions.Invokable

        Invokable.UnexpectedArgumentException

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface SLogo.FunctionEvaluate.Functions.Invokable

        invoke, readArgs

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        default Variable eval(Repl repl,
                      Environment env,
                      Expression... exprs)
        Iteratively evaluates this command over each subset of the arguments passed in. Returns the final value.
        Specified by:
        eval in interface Invokable
        Parameters:
        repl - Current REPL session
        env - Current dynamic runtime environment
        exprs - Array of arguments to this command
        Returns:
        Result of evaluating this command

      • minimumArity

        int minimumArity()
        Specified by:
        minimumArity in interface Invokable
        Returns:
        Minimum number of arguments in this Invokable

      • operation

        Variable operation(Repl repl,
                   Environment env,
                   Expression... exprs)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        The base implementation of a single iteration of this command. The operation is applied to each set of arguments passed in.
        Parameters:
        repl - Current REPL session
        env - Current dynamic runtime environment
        exprs - Array of arguments to this command
        Returns:
        The result of evaluating this function over a single set of inputs
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if operation throws an exception
